instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture on internal or external - Turns on with chime and capslock response.
threads.message:
I disconnected the internal LCD and tested on the external, but still no picture.
NVRAM reset, still no.

Tried with a spare LCD. Same

Very dusty inside. No visible liquid

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture on internal or external - Turns on with chime and capslock response.
threads.message:
Do you have USB activity?
It is recognized in Target Disk mode?
Did you try DFU mode?

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture on internal or external - Turns on with chime and capslock response.
threads.message:
There is USB activity
I can detect it in target disk ode but comes with this message
[ATTACH type="full" width="436px" alt="1670289755210.png"]60884[/ATTACH]

DFU mode recognises it but fails to Revive it. Customer is after the data

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture on internal or external - Turns on with chime and capslock response.
threads.message:
Probably another problem caused by File Vault.
Or just some bad NAND...

threads.title: SOLVED - <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No picture on internal or external - Turns on with chime and capslock response.
threads.message:
Found some dirt and light oxidation around NANDs. Cleaned and now imaging in Target Disk mode. 
Unreliable Macs. 
[ATTACH type="full"]60887[/ATTACH]
